messages.content: You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
What are the provided URLs in the document for?
The provided URLs are for accessing the preprocess_imagenet.py script on GitHub and the tutorial for Horovod with TensorFlow on the AWS documentation site.
What is the command to preprocess ImageNet data using the preprocess_imagenet.py script?

The command to preprocess ImageNet data is: 
```
python preprocess_imagenet.py \ --local_scratch_dir=[YOUR DIRECTORY] \ --imagenet_username=[imagenet account] \ --imagenet_access_key=[imagenet access key]
```
What should be done after data transformation according to the document?
After data transformation, you should create a new bucket and sync or copy feature sets to the bucket, and then create a snapshot of the EBS volume.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
How many GPUs and instances were used in the hvd_train_log?
The hvd_train_log used 64 GPUs and 8 p3dn.24xlarge instances.
What was the speed and loss at step 7000 in the hvd_train_log?
At step 7000 in the hvd_train_log, the speed was 41958.4 and the loss was 0.624.
How long did the training in the hvd_train_log take to finish?
The training in the hvd_train_log finished in 2685.1825189590454 seconds.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
What is the size of the file model.ckpt-10000.meta?
The size of the file model.ckpt-10000.meta is 5709416 bytes.
What is the timestamp for the file model.ckpt-20000.data-00001-of-00002?
The timestamp for the file model.ckpt-20000.data-00001-of-00002 is Sep 23 02:54.
What is the file permission for model.ckpt-20000.index?
The file permission for model.ckpt-20000.index is -rw-rw-r--.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
What is the file size and name of the file created on October 1 at 00:01?
The file created on October 1 at 00:01 is named ILSVRC2012_bbox_train_v2.tar.gz and its size is 19537608 bytes.
Which file has the largest size and what is its size?
The file with the largest size is ILSVRC2012_img_train.tar, and its size is 147897477120 bytes.
What is the format used for data transformation and what tool is recommended for RecordIO format?
For data transformation, the RecordIO format is used, and the recommended tool is im2rec.py.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
Why is it important to install OpenCV when working with ImageNet raw data?
It is important to install OpenCV because if you do not install it, you cannot convert ImageNet raw data to RecordIO files since im2rec.py utilizes some OpenCV functions.
Why is Python2 recommended over Python3 for Tensorflow models repository?
Python2 is recommended over Python3 because many codes of the Tensorflow models repository do not work on Python3.
What steps are involved in extracting the training set for ImageNet?

The steps involved in extracting the training set for ImageNet include creating a directory named 'train', moving the ILSVRC2012_img_train.tar file to the 'train' directory, extracting the tar file, and then creating subdirectories for each tar file and extracting their contents. After extraction, you should check if the number of directories is 1,000.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
Who is the author of the document on Fast Training with ImageNet on on-demand EC2 GPU instances using Horovod?
The author of the document is Daekeun Kim (daekeun@amazon.com).
What is the goal of the document?
The goal of the document is to provide guidance for people who need distributed GPU training using Horovod for experimental purposes.
What type of instances are recommended for data preparation and transformation, and what type for distributed training?

For data preparation and data transformation, cheaper instances like t2.large with 1.0TB EBS volume are recommended. For distributed training, multiple GPU instances like p2, p3, g3, and g4 are needed.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
What is the purpose of the shell commands shown in the image?

The shell commands are used to download the ImageNet dataset. They involve exporting your username and access key, navigating to the appropriate directory, moving a file, and running a script in the background to download the dataset.
What are the specific shell commands to download the ImageNet dataset?

The specific shell commands to download the ImageNet dataset are:
```sh
$ export IMAGENET_USERNAME=[YOUR_USERNAME]
$ export IMAGENET_ACCESS_KEY=[YOUR_ACCESS_KEY]
$ cd imagenet/data
$ mv imagenet_2012_validation_synset_labels.txt synsets.txt
$ nohup bash download_imagenet.sh . synsets.txt >& download.log &
```
What should be checked after training according to the text?
After training, you should check the training log and evaluation log by checking the imagenet_resnet folder.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
What should be done after data transformation in the process of backing up and copying to S3?
After data transformation, you should create a new bucket and sync or copy feature sets to the bucket, and then create a snapshot of the EBS volume.
What is the first step mentioned for training the ResNet-50 model with Horovod?
The first step mentioned for training the ResNet-50 model with Horovod is to refer to the provided links if you just want to train on a single machine, specifically using RecordIO and TFRecord.
Where can you find a hands-on guide for fast training of ImageNet on on-demand EC2 GPU instances with Horovod?

You can find a hands-on guide for fast training of ImageNet on on-demand EC2 GPU instances with Horovod at the following link: https://daekeun.notion.site/Hands-on-Fast-Training-ImageNet-on-on-demand-EC2-GPU-instances-with-Horovod-eb49f580d1304082b497d91dec887dca.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
What are the different storage locations for the ImageNet dataset mentioned in the text?

The different storage locations for the ImageNet dataset mentioned are: s3://dataset-image/imagenet/raw (raw jpeg), s3://dataset-image/imagenet/tfrecord (TFRecord before resizing), s3://dataset-image/imagenet/tfrecord-resized (TFRecord after resizing to 224x224), and s3://dataset-image/imagenet/recordio (RecordIO after resizing to 256x256).
Why was the ImageNet dataset not resized to 224x224 in one of the storage locations?

The ImageNet dataset was not resized to 224x224 in one of the storage locations because the article at https://forums.fast.ai/t/impact-of-image-resizing-on-model-training-time-and-performance/1980 shows different validation accuracy for resizing strategy.
What are the steps for setting up an EC2 instance for data transformation of the ImageNet dataset?

The steps for setting up an EC2 instance for data transformation of the ImageNet dataset include creating an EC2 instance (Ubuntu 18.04 or 16.04, t2.micro is available but t2.large is recommended due to memory size), and creating an EBS volume (1.0TB) for the ImageNet dataset and attaching it to the EC2 instance.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
How can you use TensorFlow's download script to download the ImageNet dataset?

You can use TensorFlow's download script by exporting your username and access key. The steps include exporting your username and access key, navigating to the imagenet/data directory, renaming the validation synset labels file, and running the download script with nohup.
What is the alternative method if TensorFlow's download script does not work?
The alternative method involves downloading the ImageNet dataset manually using wget commands for different parts of the dataset, such as the training images, bounding boxes, and validation images.
How do you extract the validation set after downloading it manually?

To extract the validation set, you need to create a validation directory, move the ILSVRC2012_img_val.tar file into it, navigate to the validation directory, and then extract the contents using the tar command.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
What is the command prompt shown in the text?
The command prompt shown in the text is "ubuntu@ip-172-31-3-51: ~ /examples/horovod/tensorflow/imagenet_resnet (ssh)".
What is the total size of the files listed in the directory?
The total size of the files listed in the directory is 646280.
What is the size and date of the file named "model.ckpt-10000.data-00001-of-00002"?
The file "model.ckpt-10000.data-00001-of-00002" has a size of 204668736 and is dated Sep 23 01:53.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
What is the first step to prepare the validation set for ImageNet?

The first step is to create a directory named 'validation' using the command `$ mkdir validation`, then move the file `ILSVRC2012_img_val.tar` into the 'validation' directory using `$ mv ILSVRC2012_img_val.tar validation`, and finally change into the 'validation' directory using `$ cd validation`.
How do you extract the contents of the validation set tar file?
You extract the contents of the validation set tar file by using the command `$ tar xf ILSVRC2012_img_val.tar`.
What should be done after extracting the validation set?

After extracting the validation set, you should move the jpeg files (ILSVRC2012_val_00000001.JPEG, ..., ILSVRC2012_val_00050000.JPEG) into 1,000 directories, each representing a unique category, using the provided script from the URL: https://github.com/juliensimon/aws/blob/master/mxnet/imagenet/build_validation_tree.sh.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
What is the size of the ImageNet training and validation sets?
ImageNet consists of 138GB for the training set and 6.3GB for the validation set.
Why do you need additional space when working with ImageNet on an EC2 instance?
Additional space is needed to extract tar files and to transform the data into feature sets like TFRecord and RecordIO.
What is an example command to create and attach a volume to an EC2 instance using AWS CLI?

An example command to create and attach a volume to an EC2 instance using AWS CLI is:
$ aws ec2 create-volume \ --size 1000 \ --region [YOUR_AWS_REGION] \ --availability-zone [YOUR_AZ] \ --volume-type sc1 \ --tag-specifications 'ResourceType=volume,Tags=[{Key=Name,Value=ImageNet}]'
$ aws ec2 attach-volume \ --volume-id vol-[YOUR_EC2_volume_id] \ --instance-id i-[YOUR_EC2_instance_id] \ --device /dev/sdf
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
How many GPUs and instances were used in vd_train_log?
vd_train_log used 32 GPUs and 4 p3dn.24xlarge instances.
What was the Horovod size and TensorFlow version used in eval_hvd_train.log?
The Horovod size was 8 and the TensorFlow version used was TF1.13.1.
What was the top1 and top5 accuracy at step 14075 in eval_hvd_train.log?
At step 14075, the top1 accuracy was 75.821 and the top5 accuracy was 92.90.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
What should you do after formatting the EBS volume?
After formatting the EBS volume, you should mount it on /data and then change the owner to ec2-user: ec2-user. You can refer to the AWS documentation if you do not know how to mount it.
What repositories should be downloaded for this setup?

You should download the MXNet repository and the TensorFlow models repository. This can be done by running the commands: `git clone https://github.com/tensorflow/models.git` and `git clone https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet.git` or by typing `pip install mxnet`.
What is the purpose of using symbolic links in this setup?

The symbolic links are used for convenience to link directories such as linking `imagenet` to `/data/models/research/inception/inception` and `mxnet` to `/usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mxnet`.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
What type of EC2 instance is recommended for distributed GPU training using Uber's Horovod or Tensorflow's DistributedStrategy?
p3.16xlarge or p3dn.24xlarge is recommended for distributed GPU training using Uber's Horovod or Tensorflow's DistributedStrategy.
What is the default root volume size for the recommended EC2 instances, and what is the suggested increase?

The default root volume size for the recommended EC2 instances is 75GB, but it is recommended to increase it to 100GB since training logs and model checkpoints are stored in the root volume if you do not modify the training configuration.
What should you do if you do not want to increase the root volume size of the EC2 instance?
If you do not want to increase the root volume size, you can delete some conda environments such as Theano, Chainer, Caffe, and Caffe2 after logging in to the EC2 instance.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
What do you need to do if you want to train on distributed GPUs?
If you want to train on distributed GPUs, you need to create multiple GPU instances with the same setting.
What is an example of multiple GPU instances for distributed training?
An example of multiple GPU instances for distributed training is 8 p3dn.24xlarge instances.
What is the URL for the remaining steps in the tutorial?
The URL for the remaining steps in the tutorial is https://docs.aws.amazon.com/dlami/latest/devguide/tutorial-horovod-tensorflow.html.
You are the SME (Subject Matter Expert) in Distributed training on Cloud. Please answer the questions accurately. If the question is in English, write your answer in English.
What can you skip if you do not want to invent the wheel again?
You can skip step 1 if you do not want to invent the wheel again because everything is stored in the s3 bucket.
What is the title of the hands-on guide mentioned in the text?
The title of the hands-on guide is "Fast Training ImageNet on on-demand EC2 GPU instances with Horovod."
Where can you find the hands-on guide for fast training ImageNet on on-demand EC2 GPU instances with Horovod?
You can find the hands-on guide at the following URL: https://daekeun.notion.site/Hands-on-Fast-Training-ImageNet-on-on-demand-EC2-GPU-instances-with-Horovod-eb49f580d1304082b497d91dec887dca.
